newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish primate blasts left over anti-Church line.
newsitem.headline: Polish primate blasts left over anti-Church line.

text.p: Poland's Roman Catholic Primate unleashed a strong attack on leftists on Thursday over a wide range of issues that have strained Church-state relations.
"Marxism as a system of government has passed, but people reared on Marxism remain and in high places," Cardinal Jozef Glemp told some 20,000 worshippers at an outdoor Corpus Christi procession.

"They find spiritual values which contradict their materialist vision of society repugnant...the spirit of Marxism is rising over different fields of endeavour," the cardinal said in the televised sermon.

As examples, he pointed a finger at the education ministry for publishing "sex education education textbooks with pornographic accents" and attempting to remove religious instruction from kindergartens.
"Who can be opposed to little children's natural inclination towards God? Is it not then that they first learn the difference between good and evil," the primate said in the televised sermon.

Cardinal Glemp triggered spontaneous applause when he said: "It is impossible to conclude concordats with totalitarian Marxist states. Is it not strange, therefore, that also in our country a concordat cannot come into being?"
He was referring to Poland's 1993 treaty with the Vatican, whose ratification has since been blocked by the left-led parliament.

The cardinal was also critical of leftists and liberals for disparaging Wednesday's decision by the Constitutional Tribunal which ruled that a liberal 1996 abortion law was in conflict with the constitution.
